items.title: Rs 23,000 crore in a month: How an Asia fund became silent winner in India's hottest IPO streak
items.summary: Peak XV Partners, formerly Sequoia India, is reaping significant rewards from India's recent IPO surge. Four key portfolio companies, including Groww and Pine Labs, generated nearly Rs 23,000 crore in listing value and substantial cash gains. This success highlights the firm's strategy of early, sustained investment in high-growth ventures, bolstering its distribution track record.

items.title: Rupee falls 20 paise to 90.07 against US dollar in early trade

items.summary: OpenAI has appointed Slack CEO Denise Dresser as its first chief of revenue

items.title: India's worst smallcap crash in 7 years begs the question: Will 2026 be even worse?

items.title: Rupee falls 20 paise to 90.07 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: The Indian rupee weakened by 20 paise to 90.07 against the US dollar today, influenced by import demand and upcoming US Federal Reserve policy cues. Traders are keenly awaiting US-India trade talks, scheduled to begin December 10, for potential positive impact on the rupee. The dollar index saw a slight rise, while domestic equity markets traded higher.

items.title: IndiGo Flight Status today: Check latest cancellations and updates from major airports
items.summary: IndiGo news today: IndiGo flights continue to be cancelled at major airports, including Bengaluru and Goa, impacting thousands of passengers. Despite the airline's CEO apologizing and stating operations are stable, the government has ordered a 10 percent reduction in IndiGo's flight schedule to ensure stability and prevent further disruptions. This move aims to address the ongoing flight chaos.

items.title: Wakefit IPO subscribed 60% on Day 3 so far, weak GMP.  Should you invest?

Despite strong retail participation, institutional interest lags. The company, while growing revenue, continues to post losses, raising concerns about profitability and valuation.

items.title: Sensex jumps 200 pts, Nifty above 25,850 ahead of Fed rate decision
items.summary: Indian stock markets opened on a positive note today. The Sensex and Nifty have ended a two-day decline. Investors are proceeding with caution. This comes ahead of a significant U.S. Federal Reserve rate decision scheduled for later tonight. The markets are awaiting further direction.

items.title: Silver reaches new all-time high of Rs 1,90,374/kg; will gold follow suit?
items.summary: Bullion started Wednesday on a strong note, with silver futures hitting a record Rs 1,90,374/kg and gold trading above Rs 1.30 lakh/10 grams. Globally, silver extended gains after crossing $60/oz for the first time, reaching $61.4797/oz, driven by speculative bets that the US Federal Reserve will announce a 25-bps rate cut at its Dec. 9–10 meeting.

items.title: India's IPO frenzy hits century to shatter 18-year record, but easy money days are over
items.summary: India's IPO market has achieved a historic milestone, surpassing 100 listings for the first time in 18 years. This surge has raised a record Rs 1.6 lakh crore. However, investors are experiencing lower listing-day returns, indicating a shift in market dynamics. The IPO pipeline remains strong with major companies preparing to go public, suggesting continued fundraising activity.

items.title: AU Small Finance Bank shares in focus as govt increases foreign investment limit to 74%

Supply tightness in silver is also a factor. Lower interest rates generally benefit precious metals. Hindustan Zinc is India's only pure-play silver company. Its stock is sensitive to silver price movements.

These disruptions are escalating operating costs, forcing airlines to rely on older planes and leading to an estimated $11 billion financial hit in 2025 due to lost efficiencies and increased expenses.

items.title: Vietnam's Vingroup plans big India push with $3b investment

items.title: RBI wants groups to untie their NBFC knots
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is urging large business groups to consolidate their non-banking finance and investment companies. This move aims to simplify structures for better risk assessment and regulatory oversight. Groups with multiple NBFCs, especially those with overlapping businesses, are being advised to merge entities.

India's regulatory system needs to mature for quicker access to breakthrough therapies. Stronger intellectual property protection and global standardisation are key. This will help reduce delays in drug availability for patients.

This move could benefit new-age general insurers, as vehicle insurance is a significant part of their business. Discussions are ongoing and in early stages.

items.title: Air India to deploy specialised crew, aircraft to mitigate fog-related flight disruptions

The northern parts of India, including Air India's primary hub, Delhi, experience low visibility due to dense fog, with a potential to have a cascading impact on flight schedules across the network.

items.title: Electronics Inc asks govt to OK China JVs with 26% stake cap

The government is reviewing applications for the Electronic Component Manufacturing Scheme.

items.title: RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra urges banks to use tech and trim costs in easing cycle
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra met bank chief executives, emphasizing that rate cuts and technology adoption should lower costs and boost efficiency for sustainable growth and financial inclusion. items.title: RBI did its part, now time for markets to show maturity: SBI report
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate to boost economic growth. This move comes as India experiences strong GDP expansion and very low inflation. SBI Research suggests markets should act with maturity. The central bank has lowered its inflation forecast for the fiscal year.

items.title: Ratan Khatri: The Matka King who architected a million-dollar betting syndicate
items.summary: A shadow economy built on matka made a few rich while devastating countless lives, with the understated Ratan Khatri at its core.

items.summary: Timelines for patent disputes in India can stretch years, often a setback for companies working with time-sensitive patent deadlines.

items.title: Budget 2026: States may get bigger capex push as Centre plans higher interest-free loans
items.summary: The allocation under the Special Assistance to States for Capital Investment (SASCI) scheme may be raised to Rs 1.8-2 lakh crore for 2026-27 from Rs 1.5 lakh crore budgeted for the current fiscal.

items.title: Too much power, too little grid: Why Adani, NTPC and JSW are forced to cut solar power production
items.summary: What happens when solar power capacity races ahead while transmission capacity lags? A bottleneck, that has forced the grid regulator to step in and direct power production cuts at Adani Group, NTPC Green, KKR-backed Serentica, EQT-backed Zelestra and JSW Group

items.title: RBI cuts policy rate by 25 bps
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India cut its policy interest rate by a quarter-point, citing a 'Goldilocks' economy with low inflation and strong growth. The central bank also injected liquidity to ensure rate cuts reach consumers and addressed currency market movements. Inflation forecasts were lowered, and growth targets were raised.

items.title: Gujarat farmer distress: Where cotton clouds hang heavy
items.summary: Following heavy rainfall in October and the subsequent drop in the price of cotton, six farmers have died by suicide in Gujarat. The Union government’s decision to allow duty-free cotton imports has only added to their woes. A.M. Jigeesh reports on how farmers in Gujarat’s cotton belt are calling for government intervention

items.title: Rate cut signals RBI’s pivot to growth amid sharp inflation slowdown
items.summary: With GDP growth at 8% and CPI inflation at 2.2%, the RBI cut the repo rate by 25 bps to stimulate the economy. The central bank's actions, including liquidity measures, aim to support growth amid US tariff-related headwinds.

items.title: Russia keen to increase fertiliser supplies to India: President of the Russian producers’ body
items.summary: Russia has significantly boosted fertilizer exports to India, becoming its top supplier and accounting for 26% of imports. Russian officials are ready to further increase environmentally friendly fertilizer supplies, but cite trade barriers like a 5.5% import duty as a constraint. India's state-run companies are also partnering with Russia's Uralchem to build a new urea manufacturing complex.

items.title: RBI Governor expects deposit rates to ease but that may not be easy
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra anticipates deposit rates will moderate, mirroring the central bank's 125 basis point policy rate reduction. He noted that real interest rates remain high despite nominal rate decreases, benefiting both borrowers and savers. Data shows a 105 basis point decline in weighted average domestic term deposit rates, though bankers suggest further reductions are limited.

items.title: IndiGo cancels 1,000 flights, gets exemption on night duty limits for pilots
items.summary: No flights from Delhi and Chennai airports; CEO says normalcy will take 5-10 days

items.title: RBI does not target any band for rupee, allows it to find its own level: Guv Malhotra
items.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra stated the central bank does not target specific bands for the rupee, allowing market forces to determine its value. While acknowledging market fluctuations, the RBI aims to curb excessive volatility.  A recent USD 5 billion swap is a liquidity measure, not a direct intervention to support the rupee.

items.title: IMF critique: RBI guv says Indian data fairly accurate, DG downplays 'crawl' comment
items.summary: India's central bank has responded to International Monetary Fund concerns about data and currency management. Reserve Bank of India officials stated that GDP and inflation estimates are accurate, with scope for improvement. They explained that data classifications are generally good, with national accounts receiving a lower grade due to an outdated base year.

Engagement continues on matters of national interest.
